title: Dad desperate to marry after doctors find fist-sized lump weeks after daughter's birth
text:

When his daughter Amelia came into the world, all Darren Watson could think about was how happy he was with his growing family.

Just six weeks later, his entire world threatened to come crashing down around him as doctors found a cancerous lump the size of a fist in his chest.

Darren and his partner Claire Larter, quickly realised there was one thing missing which he needed to make their life complete - just as he faced the possibility of his own life coming to a premature end.

Now the 34-year-old is desperate to marry Claire and is running a crowdfunding appeal in a bid to fund a lavish wedding.

Darren, from Bransholme, Hull, told Hull Live : "I have an amazing girlfriend and family, she has coped so well and it's things like this that put your life into perspective.

"I couldn't imagine my life without her, so I'd like to aim and give her a very special wedding she deserves."

(Image: Hull Daily Mail / MEN Media)

Darren had only just celebrated Amelia's arrival in February this year when doctors told him about the devastating discovery of a primary mediastinal large b-cell lymphoma in his chest.

The mass, which is resting above his heart, was quickly treated with chemotherapy, but harsher methods, including radiotherapy and stem cell treatments, are now needed to rid Darren of the cancerous lump.

He is desperate to marry 36-year-old Claire, who has been his rock throughout the past seven months, in April 2020.

The pair have been together for five years and between them have four children.

Before the diagnosis, Darren was active and worked as a full-time carer which he has had to give up due to him feeling drained with his rigorous cancer treatment.

(Image: Hull Daily Mail / MEN Media)

Darren, who has had extended spells away from his family while being treated in hospital, described his family's year as "pretty bad" and hailed Claire's unwavering support during testing times.

He said: "The start of the year was great, Amelia was born on February 18, but six weeks later I was diagnosed with cancer.

"I had symptoms at that time, but I didn't know what it was. I was kept in hospital until they diagnosed me after I was sent for a scan.

"It has been pretty hard, especially my girlfriend having a house to run, kids to sort, newborn baby and visiting me. We have decided to try to make something good out of this and get married."

He hopes the wedding will give the family something to look forward to and to focus on in the coming months.

Posting on their fundraising page, Darren said: "We are basically asking if any friends and family would like to help donate so I can try make this day the special day this amazing woman deserves."

description: Darren Watson, from Hull, is crowdfunding to give his partner Claire Larter 'a very special wedding she deserves' after doctors found a large lymphoma in his chest
